snippet: A possible expansion of a federal insurance program comes as high crop prices are prompting farmers to expand into millions of acres of land once considered unsuitable for farming.
abstract: Congress is considering expanding a federal insurance program that would reimburse farmers for most losses or drops in prices, even as high crop prices are prompting farmers to expand into millions of acres once considered unsuitable for farming; combination could cost the government billions of dollars if the newly farmed land does not yield enough crops or if prices fall.
lead_paragraph: A possible expansion of a federal insurance program comes as high crop prices are prompting farmers to expand into millions of acres of land once considered unsuitable for farming.

headline.seo: Crop Insurance Proposal Could Cost U.S. Billions
headline.main: Crop Insurance Proposal Could Cost U.S. Billions
headline.print_headline: Amid Growth, a Plan To Insure Risks on Crops
